article_title: N.J. Businesses Face Obstacles, Christie Warns
article_text:
New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie warned Tuesday that the state would raise taxes and kowtow to public-sector unions if a Democrat succeeds him in 2017, telling business leaders that the state’s corporate climate is in peril.

“You elect a Democratic governor with a Democratic Legislature, and the pigs will be charging down State Street,” in Trenton, said Mr. Christie, a GOP presidential candidate, in a speech at the New Jersey Business...
